content:
Size3D Struct

Definition

Data structure that describes the size of a three-dimensional object.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3DConverter))]
[System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer(typeof(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Converters.Size3DValueSerializer))]
public struct Size3D : IFormattable
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
Size3D

Examples

This example shows how to determine if two Size3D structures are equal using the Size3D static Equals method.

The following code illustrates how to check Size3D structures for equality. The Size3D structures are declared and assigned values. The Equals method is then used to determine if the two structures are equal. 

private bool size3DEqualityExample()
{

    // Checks if two Size3D structures are equal using the static Equals method. 
    // Returns a Boolean.

    // Declaring Size3D structure without initializing x,y,z values
    Size3D size1 = new Size3D();

    // Delcaring Size3D structure and initializing x,y,z values
    Size3D size2 = new Size3D(5, 10, 15);
    Boolean areEqual;

    // Assigning values to size1
    size1.X = 2;
    size1.Y = 4;
    size1.Z = 6;

    // checking for equality
    areEqual = Size3D.Equals(size1, size2);

    // areEqual is False
    return areEqual;

}

Remarks

Size3D and Rect3D are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.

XAML Text Usage

Constructors

Size3D(Double, Double, Double)

Initializes a new instance of the Size3D structure.

public Size3D (double x, double y, double z);
Parameters
x
Double

The new Size3D structure's stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X* value.

y
Double

The new Size3D structure's stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y* value.

z
Double

The new Size3D structure's stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* value.

Remarks

The X, Y, and Z values must be non-negative.

Properties

Empty

Gets a value that represents an empty Size3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D Empty { get; }
Value
Size3D

An empty instance of a Size3D structure.

Remarks

A Size3D structure with X, Y, and Z values set to 0 is not empty. An empty Size3D structure has X, Y, and Z values set to negative infinity. This is the only time a Size3D structure can have negative values.

IsEmpty

Gets a value that indicates whether this Size3D structure is empty.

public bool IsEmpty { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the Size3D structure is empty; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

A Size3D structure with X, Y, and Z values set to 0 is not empty. An empty Size3D structure has X, Y, and Z values set to negative infinity. This is the only time a Size3D structure can have negative values.

X

Gets or sets the X value of this Size3D structure.

public double X { get; set; }
Value
Double

The X value of this Size3D structure. The default value is 0.

Remarks

The X, Y, and Z values must be non-negative.

Size3D and Rect3D are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.

XAML Text Usage

Y

Gets or sets the Y value of this Size3D structure.

public double Y { get; set; }
Value
Double

The Y value of this Size3D structure. The default value is 0.

Remarks

The X, Y, and Z values must be non-negative.

Size3D and Rect3D are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.

XAML Text Usage

Z

Gets or sets the Z value of this Size3D structure.

public double Z { get; set; }
Value
Double

The Z value of this Size3D structure. The default value is 0.

Remarks

The X, Y, and Z values must be non-negative.

Size3D and Rect3D are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.

XAML Text Usage

Methods

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is a Size3D structure and whether the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y* and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* properties of the specified Object are equal to the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y* and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* properties of this Size3D structure.

public override bool Equals (object o);
Parameters
o
Object

The Object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if instances are equal; otherwise, false.

true if o is a Size3D structure and is identical with this Size3D structure; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Because Double values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Size3D instances that are logically equal might fail.

Equals(Size3D)

Compares two Size3D structures for equality.

public bool Equals (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D value);
Parameters
value
Size3D

The instance of Size3D to compare to this instance.

Returns
Boolean

true if instances are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Because Double values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Size3D instances that are logically equal might fail.

Equals(Size3D, Size3D)

Compares two Size3D structures for equality. Two Size3D structures are equal if the values of their stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* properties are the same.

public static bool Equals (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D size1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D size2);
Parameters
size1
Size3D

The first Size3D structure to compare.

size2
Size3D

The second Size3D structure to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if instances are equal; otherwise, false.

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* components of size1 and size2 are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Because Double values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Size3D instances that are logically equal might fail.

GetHashCode()

Returns a hash code for this Size3D structure.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

A hash code for this Size3D structure.

Parse(String)

Converts a String representation of a three-dimensional size structure into the equivalent Size3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D Parse (string source);
Parameters
source
String

The String representation of the three-dimensional size structure.

Returns
Size3D

The equivalent Size3D structure.

ToString()

Creates a String representation of this Size3D structure.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

Returns a String containing the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* values of this Size3D structure.

Remarks

If a Size3D structure is empty, the string "empty" is returned, rather than the X, Y, and Z values of the Size3D structure.

ToString(IFormatProvider)

Creates a String representation of this Size3D structure.

public string ToString (IFormatProvider provider);
Parameters
provider
IFormatProvider

Culture-specific formatting information.

Returns
String

Returns a String containing the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* values of this Size3D structure.

Remarks

If a Size3D structure is empty, the string "empty" is returned, rather than the X, Y, and Z values of the Size3D structure.

Operators

op_Equality(Size3D, Size3D)

Compares two Size3D structures for equality. Two Size3D structures are equal if the values of their stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* properties are the same.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D size1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D size2);
Parameters
size1

The first Size3D structure to compare.

size2
Size3D

The second Size3D structure to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* components of size1 and size2 are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Because Double values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Size3D instances that are logically equal might fail.

op_Inequality(Size3D, Size3D)

Compares two Size3D structures for inequality. Two Size3D structures are not equal if the values of their stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y* and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* properties are different.

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Y* and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D.Z* coordinates of size1 and size2 are different; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Because Double values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Size3D instances that are logically equal might fail.
